medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute febrile illness with myalgia, headache, and other systemic symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with acute-onset fever and shaking chills for 48 hours before admission, worsening severe frontal headaches, photophobia, myalgia, and arthralgia. Patient 2 developed fever and malaise, with severe fatigue and chills two days before admission. Symptoms include anorexia and poor fluid intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 2 has a medical history of babesiosis in the summer of 2010, successfully treated with atovaquone and azithromycin. Patient 1: Not specified.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1 lived with his family, none of whom had a current illness. Patient 2 lived with his wife, who did not have a current illness.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 1 was active, playing golf daily before illness, and owned a dog. Patient 2 engaged in domestic gardening and landscaping and resided part-time in Florida.
